<image_start>[problem_image_1]<image_end>

REASONING TRACE:

THOUGHT 1: Step 1 instructs to add 1 blue sphere, 1 orange cube, and 1 purple cone. This adds a total of 3 objects. I will visualize the scene after these additions.
<image_start>[reasoning_image_1]<image_end>
THOUGHT 2: The visual update shows the objects after Step 1. Counting the objects in this image, there are now 13 objects.
THOUGHT 3: Step 2 requires removing 1 purple pyramid, 1 purple donut, and 1 purple cone. This removes a total of 3 objects. I will visualize the scene after these removals.
<image_start>[reasoning_image_2]<image_end>
THOUGHT 4: The updated image reflects the removals from Step 2. Counting the objects in this new state, there are 10 objects remaining.
THOUGHT 5: Step 3 involves adding 1 purple pyramid, 1 purple cube, and 1 black donut. This adds a total of 3 objects. I will generate a visual representation of the scene after these additions.
<image_start>[reasoning_image_3]<image_end>
THOUGHT 6: The image after Step 3 shows the updated collection of objects. Counting them, there are now 12 objects.
THOUGHT 7: Step 4 requires adding 1 purple pyramid, 1 black cylinder, and 1 orange pyramid. This adds a total of 3 objects. I will visualize the final state after these last additions.
<image_start>[reasoning_image_4]<image_end>
THOUGHT 8: The final image displays the objects after all operations are complete. Counting the objects in this image yields the final total. There are 14 objects.

FINAL ANSWER:
